Description: Rim and shoulder fragment (mended from three sherds) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery column-krater; interior; reserved save for thick horizontal band with added white and red stripes at the rim; on top of rim maenader band; on outside squares; exterior, yellow-cream slip: part of shoulder panel with glazed handle area to right; tongues above panel; in it, part of head of a wild goat to right, head turned back; filling ornament: cross and pendant drops.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Cambridge NA6 and NA7. Sherd joins Oxford 1912.34.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.291)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
